FL.content: there is nothing more just than deconstruction
new readings = revolutions (though he does remind everyone they’re on 5<sup><small>th</small></sup> avenue)
FL.linkedContent: new readings = revolutions (though he does remind everyone they’re on 5th avenue)

LOBL.content: [The promise he doesn’t keep: anticipate translatable problems, see pp. 175-76]
LOBL.linkedContent: [The promise he doesn’t keep: anticipate translatable problems, see pp. 175-76]

LOBL.content: story of the woman [Miss Blind feminist] who wouldn’t let Derrida have his “mad hypothesis”  [2 women approaching via hymen w/out narrator: absolute terror]
LOBL.linkedContent: story of the woman [Miss Blind feminist] who wouldn’t let Derrida have his “mad hypothesis” [2 women approaching via hymen w/out narrator: absolute terror]

LOBL.content: Derrida did not keep his promise to consider translatability [see p. ~89], but keeps a secret
LOBL.linkedContent: Derrida did not keep his promise to consider translatability [see p. ~89], but keeps a secret

MC.content: I never wrote a “self-centered” text:  I wanted to, I fell upon the others [Nietzsche says something quite similar]
MC.linkedContent: I never wrote a “self-centered” text: I wanted to, I fell upon the others [Nietzsche says something quite similar]

MC.content: [conclusion] “perhaps…I [am] under the influence of some drug” referring to pharmakon
MC.linkedContent: [conclusion] “perhaps…I [am] under the influence of some drug” referring to pharmakon

H.content: two sources of sighs, two nostalgias, their dead ones and their language > return home, or exiles find home in language
H.linkedContent: two sources of sighs, two nostalgias, their dead ones and their language > return home, or exiles find home in language

SPOM.content: Marcellus anticipated la venue d’un autre scholar, had to wait several centuries [for Derrida], one who can think possibility of specter, specter as possibility, who can address spirits, who knows that such is the condition of address, mad enough to unlock such a possibility
SPOM.linkedContent: Marcellus anticipated la venue d’un autre scholar, had to wait several centuries [for Derrida], one who can think possibility of specter, specter as possibility, who can address spirits, who knows that such is the condition of address, mad enough to unlock such a possibility

PP.content: Derrida recognizes that the cicada myth in Phaedrus also includes question about writing [before the Theuth myth], he asks: “has anyone ever picked up on it?”
PP.linkedContent: Derrida recognizes that the cicada myth in Phaedrus also includes question about writing [before the Theuth myth], he asks: “has anyone ever picked up on it?”

VM.content: Derrida calls attention to his showing off his Parmenidean-like dialectical virtuosity
VM.linkedContent: Derrida calls attention to his showing off his Parmenidean-like dialectical virtuosity

PAS.content: Derrida wants to be violent to Blanchot, won’t just call him tu, must be more violent, more discreet than him, but in a different way
PAS.linkedContent: Derrida wants to be violent to Blanchot, won’t just call him tu, must be more violent, more discreet than him, but in a different way

PAS.content: in a moment of extreme, precipitous virtuosity, where o (mort, fors, faux, faut, zéro, mot) resonates everywhere and nom turns to mon, Derrida asks himself if his policing overzealousness [to unmask the absence of the name, le pas-de-nom] deciphers identities [maur/chot, m’: o], wants to catch everything in a dragnet (filet)
PAS.linkedContent: in a moment of extreme, precipitous virtuosity, where o (mort, fors, faux, faut, zéro, mot) resonates everywhere and nom turns to mon, Derrida asks himself if his policing overzealousness [to unmask the absence of the name, le pas-de-nom] deciphers identities [maur/chot, m’: o], wants to catch everything in a dragnet (filet)

SH.content: poem is a hermeneutic event, it has philosophical implications which draw out the limits of hermeneutic acuity; limit of philosophy and formal poetics not to be renounced, not a failure: they recall the forgetting of the mark’s annulment by forgetting it (by supposing date)
SH.linkedContent: poem is a hermeneutic event, it has philosophical implications which draw out the limits of hermeneutic acuity; limit of philosophy and formal poetics not to be renounced, not a failure: they recall the forgetting of the mark’s annulment by forgetting it (by supposing date)

POOF.content: Derrida aligning himself w/ Nietzsche’s future (new) philosophers

OH.content: Derrida comes from other heading of Algeria

F.content: Derrida’s friendship w/ Abraham and Torok was “authentic” not “hollow” or “alienated” like the words of ideologues, utopians, idolators [uses their words]
F.linkedContent: Derrida’s friendship w/ Abraham and Torok was “authentic” not “hollow” or “alienated” like the words of ideologues, utopians, idolators [uses their words]

FWT.content: future has in store things not yet registered by civil state—but already known by unconscious
FWT.linkedContent: future has in store things not yet registered by civil state—but already known by unconscious

FWT.content: prefer not to get trapped btwn naturalism & constructivism
FWT.linkedContent: prefer not to get trapped btwn naturalism & constructivism

DS.content: “or even that you, dear everyreader, retain the initiative of reading all these texts…nothing could be less certain”
DS.linkedContent: “or even that you, dear everyreader, retain the initiative of reading all these texts…nothing could be less certain”

DS.content: referring to Mallarmé [but, sounds like someone else]: burst of lightning, by him who seems to have read it all
DS.linkedContent: referring to Mallarmé [but, sounds like someone else]: burst of lightning, by him who seems to have read it all

ROP.content: [everyone has analyzed “Dream of Irma’s Injection,” so, modest Derrida, will add nothing, only differance, the something other than sense itself in the interpretation]
ROP.linkedContent: [everyone has analyzed “Dream of Irma’s Injection,” so, modest Derrida, will add nothing, only differance, the something other than sense itself in the interpretation]

ROP.content: “I’ve never much liked” theses, positions, position takings, positionings > for those waiting for my position, so they can decide, “good luck”
ROP.linkedContent: “I’ve never much liked” theses, positions, position takings, positionings > for those waiting for my position, so they can decide, “good luck”

ROP.content: Derrida refers to his modest contribution re: a question for Foucault (doesn’t Foucault’s project belong too much to “the age of psychoanalysis”?)
ROP.linkedContent: Derrida refers to his modest contribution re: a question for Foucault (doesn’t Foucault’s project belong too much to “the age of psychoanalysis”?)

SP.content: déjà, nom de ce qui s’efface ou d’avance se soustrait, laissant néanmoins une marque, une signature soustraite dans cela même don il se retire [Derrida talking about “himself”]
SP.linkedContent: déjà, nom de ce qui s’efface ou d’avance se soustrait, laissant néanmoins une marque, une signature soustraite dans cela même don il se retire [Derrida talking about “himself”]

ATIA.content: l’animal que donc je suis speaks, and no less asinine (bête) for it
ATIA.linkedContent: l’animal que donc je suis speaks, and no less asinine (bête) for it

ATIA.content: Derrida basically has us envision him naked before his cat, with a woman looking on [and he did just talk about a creature being hung like a horse (monter un cheval)]
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida basically has us envision him naked before his cat, with a woman looking on [and he did just talk about a creature being hung like a horse (monter un cheval)]

WAP.content: even among people who read me “effects of interpretation are very unequal,” these differences are irreducible
WAP.linkedContent: even among people who read me “effects of interpretation are very unequal,” these differences are irreducible

RM.content: RM not in a polemical spirit: it’s often because I subscribe to Ricouer’s propositions (whose text he can’t do justice) that I protest > they’re already there in what I wrote
RM.linkedContent: RM not in a polemical spirit: it’s often because I subscribe to Ricouer’s propositions (whose text he can’t do justice) that I protest > they’re already there in what I wrote

TR.content: which theoretical animal, animal-machine (of 3rd millennium) [cf. ATIA pp. 158-59] could measure up to this inhuman program [Derrida’s referring to the conference title]
TR.linkedContent: which theoretical animal, animal-machine (of 3rd millennium) [cf. ATIA pp. 158-59] could measure up to this inhuman program [Derrida’s referring to the conference title]

LI.content: Derrida swears his good faith (raises his hand above the typewriter)

TN.content: unlike Nancy, Derrida endlessly thinks about death w/out having had a change of hearts [socratic irony? also literal reference to Nancy’s surgery]
TN.linkedContent: unlike Nancy, Derrida endlessly thinks about death w/out having had a change of hearts [socratic irony? also literal reference to Nancy’s surgery]

TN.content: let’s not play w/ words ever: le tendre ne s’éprouve qu’à tendre (the proof of the tender is only in the tending, extending)
TN.linkedContent: let’s not play w/ words ever: le tendre ne s’éprouve qu’à tendre (the proof of the tender is only in the tending, extending)

TN.content: w/out playing on words, never: il faudrait donc entendre et tendre tendrement ces mots—tender, tend, extend > “Tiens!”: “Take (Prends)!” (tender it, à tendre on sous-entend) is not “I give you (je te donne)” (obscene phrase: assumed certainty, expected recognition)
TN.linkedContent: w/out playing on words, never: il faudrait donc entendre et tendre tendrement ces mots—tender, tend, extend > “Tiens!”: “Take (Prends)!” (tender it, à tendre on sous-entend) is not “I give you (je te donne)” (obscene phrase: assumed certainty, expected recognition)

TN.content: Derrida jokingly scolds himself for scolding Nancy: stop using this incredible vocabulary > abstain from ‘touching,’ ce concept sans répondant assuré: figures w/out figure, therefore w/out credit
TN.linkedContent: Derrida jokingly scolds himself for scolding Nancy: stop using this incredible vocabulary > abstain from ‘touching,’ ce concept sans répondant assuré: figures w/out figure, therefore w/out credit

TN.content: “my impertinence will be my tact”: baroque composition, flaunted taste for delirious profusion > response to aporias of text
TN.linkedContent: “my impertinence will be my tact”: baroque composition, flaunted taste for delirious profusion > response to aporias of text

TN.content: Derrida finds a passage in Nancy that confirms all he tried to formulate before he came across it, declares: (how lucky I am!)
TN.linkedContent: Derrida finds a passage in Nancy that confirms all he tried to formulate before he came across it, declares: (how lucky I am!)

TN.content: while discussing Levinas’ and [a certain] psychoanalysis’ secondarization of the woman, Derrida hypothesizes [?] that this complicit gesture gathers around one fundamental design: their relation to me, to the other as woman
TN.linkedContent: while discussing Levinas’ and [a certain] psychoanalysis’ secondarization of the woman, Derrida hypothesizes [?] that this complicit gesture gathers around one fundamental design: their relation to me, to the other as woman

TN.content: “I am speaking from my place as woman”
TN.linkedContent: “I am speaking from my place as woman”

TN.content: as a woman, by reversing dissymmetry [of tout autre in Levinas], Derrida has added rape [alongside other violences: hostage, persecution, etc.]
TN.linkedContent: as a woman, by reversing dissymmetry [of tout autre in Levinas], Derrida has added rape [alongside other violences: hostage, persecution, etc.]
